title: Buggy Schedule Feature
text: I've had the switch for over a year and it works great unlike the Belkin WeMo I tried. I use it to turn on my espresso machine in the morning so it's warmed up and ready for me when I get up. However the scheduling feature of the app is not reliable. If you setup different timers for different days of the week they randomly change themselves. I solved this by setting up one timer for every day of the week and just manually changed the time before I went to bed. This worked well for several months but then the timer would randomly change itself. The switch is much less compelling to me if the timer feature can't be trusted.

title: Horrible user interface
text:
The switch itself works great. I can also have the app program the switch (eventually) in the fashion that I desire-which is the only reason that this app does not get one star.

The graphical user interface in this app is a complete joke. It is taken straight out of the early 2000's. It is almost archaic to the point of non-functionality. The app is also quite buggy-as others have pointed out.

There have only been three updates in the last three years. I do not anticipate any of these issues will get fixed.

title: Great, except for schedule editing
text: The app is good overall, nice and simple and easy to use. There’s just one flaw, which is in the editing of schedules etc. This doesn’t work at all well, you basically can’t edit any existing schedule items, because they all get set to the same times. You can get around this by just disabling some of the existing ones and adding new ones, but it gets pretty annoying, so be careful when you add a schedule. Hopefully they will fix this very obvious bug, and allow for deleting of scheduled times too.

title: High School Quality App
text: This app is so poorly done & buggy that I think will return the NEO PRO switch I bought from AMAZON.  1. It doesn't save count down timer setting, so you need to reprogram count down every single time.  2. You can only program a single schedule & all subsequent attempts will overwrite the 1st program, but will be listed as a separate program, 3. There is no way to remove a schedule program, 4. Count down timer display doesn't count down ... You have to manually refresh screen to see updated count down ... and this is just the beginning.  The device HW seems ok, but please hire someone who had graduated from high school to program your app ... You'll get many returns because of the quality of your app.  I know your problem is software because I'm an engineer.  Many other people will think they have a faulty device.
